specJson.name: brightics.function.recommendation$collaborative_filtering_recommend
specJson.label: Collaborative Filtering Recommend
specJson.description:
To address some of the limitations of content-based filtering, collaborative filtering uses similarities between users and items simultaneously to provide recommendations. This allows for serendipitous recommendations; that is, collaborative filtering models can recommend an item to user A based on the interests of a similar user B. Furthermore, the embeddings can be learned automatically, without relying on hand-engineering of features.

Reference:
+ <https://developers.google.com/machine-learning/recommendation/collaborative/basics>

params.label: Number of recommendations
params.description: Number of recommendations in the top N list.

params.label: Filter already liked items
params.description: Whether to filter already liked items. If `True`, it does not recommend the items that user already rated.

params.label: Maintain the score of already scored items.
params.description: Whether to maintain the score of already scored items.

params.label: Target Users
params.description: Target users to recommend top N items. Default is all users found in data.

params.label: Number of Neighbors
params.description: Number of similar items or users to get predicted rating for target.

params.label: Filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus.
params.description: Whether to filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus.

params.label: Normalization of user tendency
params.description: To remove individual rating bias by users who consistently always use lower or higher ratings than other users.

params.label: Similarity method
params.description: Estimate how much target user and another user is similar(close).

params.label: Use Centered Mean
params.description: To make non-rated item neutral, when this is `True`, summation of rating becomes 0 for each items and the rating is 0 for non-rated items.

params.label: Use Weighted Rating
params.description: If `True`, predicted rating for target user is closer to more similar neighbor. If `False`, predicted rating for target user is equally close to k similar users.

params.label: Workers
params.description: Number of workers. Recommended only if target is all.

specJson.summary: This function provides top N items for each users by using Collaborative Filtering.

md:
# Collaborative Filtering Recommend This function provides top N items for each users by using Collaborative Filtering. ## Description To address some of the limitations of content-based filtering, collaborative filtering uses similarities between users and items simultaneously to provide recommendations. This allows for serendipitous recommendations; that is, collaborative filtering models can recommend an item to user A based on the interests of a similar user B. Furthermore, the embeddings can be learned automatically, without relying on hand-engineering of features. Reference: + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table. It must contain `User Column`, `Item Column` and `Rating Column` used in model training. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) Recommendations of Top-N items for each users with the predicted ratings. #### PARAMETER 1. **User Column***: User column name. 2. **Item Column***: Item column name. 3. **Rating Column***: Rating column name. 4. **Number of recommendations**: Number of recommendations in the top N list. 5. **Filter already liked items**: Whether to filter already liked items. If `True`, it does not recommend the items that user already rated. * Available Options: `True` , `False` 6. **Maintain the score of already scored items.**: Whether to maintain the score of already scored items. * Available Options: `True` , `False` 7. **Target Users**: Target users to recommend top N items. Default is all users found in data. 8. **Number of Neighbors**: Number of similar items or users to get predicted rating for target. 9. **Filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus.**: Whether to filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus. * Available Options: `True` , `False` 10. **Based**: Method of recommendation based. 11. **Normalization of user tendency**: To remove individual rating bias by users who consistently always use lower or higher ratings than other users. * Available Options: `True` , `False` 12. **Similarity method**: Estimate how much target user and another user is similar(close). 13. **Use Centered Mean**: To make non-rated item neutral, when this is `True`, summation of rating becomes 0 for each items and the rating is 0 for non-rated items. * Available Options: `True` , `False` 14. **Use Weighted Rating**: If `True`, predicted rating for target user is closer to more similar neighbor. If `False`, predicted rating for target user is equally close to k similar users. * Available Options: `True` , `False` 15. **Group By**: Columns to group by. 16. **Workers**: Number of workers. Recommended only if target is all. ### Python #### USAGE ``` collaborative_filtering_recommend(table, user_col, user_col, item_col, rating_col, N=10 ,filter=True, maintain_already_scored=True, targets=None, k=5, filter_minus=False, based='item', normalize=True, method='cosine', centered=True, weighted=True, group_by=None, workers=1) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table. It must contain `user_col`, `item_col` and `rating_col` used in model training. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**:(Table) Recommendations of Top-N items for each users with the predicted ratings. #### PARAMETER 1. **user_col***: User column name. * Type: *str* 2. **item_col***: Item column name. * Type: *str* 3. **rating_col***: Rating column name. * Type: *str* 4. **N**: Number of recommendations in the top N list. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 5. **filter**: Whether to filter already liked items. If `True`, it does not recommend the items that user already rated. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 6. **maintain_already_scored**: Whether to maintain the score of already scored items. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 7. **targets**: Target users to recommend top N items. Default is all users found in data. * Type: _int_, _float_, _str_ 8. **k**: Number of similar items or users to get predicted rating for target. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 5 (value >= 1) 9. **filter_minus**: Whether to filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: False 10. **based**: Method of recommendation based. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: item ( item | user ) 11. **normalize**: To remove individual rating bias by users who consistently always use lower or higher ratings than other users. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 12. **method**: Estimate how much target user and another user is similar(close). * Type: *str* * Default / Range: cosine ( cosine | pearson | jaccard | adjusted ) 13. **centered**: To make non-rated item neutral, when this is `True`, summation of rating becomes 0 for each items and the rating is 0 for non-rated items. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 14. **weighted**: If `True`, predicted rating for target user is closer to more similar neighbor. If `False`, predicted rating for target user is equally close to k similar users. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 15. **group_by**: Columns to group by. * Type: *list[str]* 16. **workers**: Number of workers. Recommended only if target is all. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 1 (value >= 1) ## Example ### VA **[Related Tutorial]** **[Sample Model]**
In this tutorial workflow, sample_ALSTrain is used to recommend Top-N items by using Collaborative Filtering algorithm based recommender model. By using Collaborative Filtering Recommend function, we can get recommendations of Top-N items for users in the data with predicted ratings. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below. ++Parameters++ 1. **User Column***: user 2. **Item Column***: item 3. **Rating Column***: rating 4. **Number of recommendations**: 10 5. **Filter already liked items**: True 6. **Maintain the score of already scored items.**: True 7. **Target Users**: None 8. **Number of Neighbors**: 5 9. **Filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus.**: False 10. **Based**: Item Based 11. **Normalization of user tendency**: True 12. **Similarity method**: Cosine 13. **Use Centered Mean**: True 14. **Use Weighted Rating**: True 15. **Group By**: None 16. **Workers**: 1 ### Python ``` from brightics.function.recommendation import collaborative_filtering_recommend input_table = inputs[0] result = collaborative_filtering_recommend(table=input_table, user_col='user', item_col='item', rating_col='rating', N=10 , filter=True, maintain_already_scored=True, targets=None, k=5, filter_minus=False, based='item', normalize=True, method='cosine', centered=True, weighted=True, group_by=None, workers=1) output = result['out_table'] ```
In this python script, sample_ALSTrain is used to recommend Top-N items by using tCollaborative Filtering algorithm based recommender model. By using Collaborative Filtering Recommend function, we can get recommendations of Top-N items for users in the data with predicted ratings.
